title: Dedicated Admin Task Pages
goal: Move each major admin accordion panel into its own lightweight page that is loaded from the icon menu.
environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom

specs.title: BundlesNavHidesManagePanels
specs.given: An admin signs in and sees the Manage Books panels expanded by default.
specs.when: They activate the Bundles nav tile.
specs.then: The Add/Available/Sold panels collapse + hide, the Bundles panel becomes visible as the only active task view, and the Bundles tile advertises itself as the current page.

specs.title: RecordSaleNavShowsStandalonePanel
specs.given: An admin is in the signed-in workspace.
specs.when: They click the Record Sale nav tile.
specs.then: The sale entry panel un-hides as its own page, the Manage Books panels collapse out of view, and the Record Sale tile reports itself as the active page.

specs.title: ReturnToManageRestoresDefaultPanels
specs.given: The admin has navigated away from Manage Books (e.g., Bundles) via the nav tiles.
specs.when: They re-select the Manage Books tile.
specs.then: The Add/Available/Sold panels un-hide and reopen while the previously selected task panel hides again so Manage Books feels like a dedicated return point.

summary.details: All Jest suites are green; the three F14-TP3 specs now confirm that nav buttons hide non-target panels and restore Manage on return.

changeNotes: Defined three RED specs for F14-TP3 covering Bundles, Record Sale, and return-to-Manage navigation so each nav tile behaves like a dedicated page.
Captured the topic metadata for F14-TP3 and pointed codex-dev at the new Jest spec files + reports.
Refined admin nav routing so only the selected tile's panels are visible, Manage panels reopen when returning, and the Customers heading receives focus after its section becomes visible.
Nav detail CTAs now reuse updateNavHash so Manage maps back to #add-book and all specs pass under npm test -- --watchAll=false --bail=0.
